title: Geometric sans with neat vertical descender on the capital Q
content:
Any help on this one fellow typophiles would be really appreciated. I'm sure i've seen it recently but can't for the life of me think where!  
Thanks  
Will

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317125414im_/http:/typophile.com/files/geo_sans_4882.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317125414im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Q_4854.jpg)

Font: 

 Novecento Sans wide 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317125414/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")
author: Will Stanford

comments.content: Can't identify it but still very interested. Could you share more details like the origin, the company, a website, more letters...? That could be helpful.

**Novecento Sans Wide Normal/Medium**  
by Jan Tonellato [Synthview, 2011]:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/synthview/novecento/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317125414/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/synthview/novecento/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/synthview/novecento/")
